abstracts.cdata!:
The overall assessment of the project is
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely. Lessons learned
            sustain that, the strength of the Bank team was paramount
            for selectivity, and prioritization of project issues,
            attributed to the experience in financial management
            activities, such as measures in investment operations, and,
            furthermore, was highly supportive in the complex area of
            procurement of information systems. However, the selection
            of consultants, and technology procurement, was time
            consuming, thus experience cautions on the inclusion of
            small information technology components, in the absence of
            adequate supervision. The continued move in re-shaping
            project components as needed, proved judicious, ensuring
            that activities would be accomplished, even under different
            operations, if necessary. Nonetheless, it is suggested that
            technical assistance lending may not be the appropriate
            instrument for the introduction of major policy changes,
            whereas structural adjustment lending - though not available
            at the time of project inception - would be the appropriate
            choice. Once again, close collaboration with partners, and
            co-financiers is suggested as critical to the success of a project.
